description:
Tree works in front garden subject to TPO 24 Beacon Hill, No.166 1997.  Works: 

 T1:  Beech:  Reduce crown height by 2m maximum by pruning with hand tools back to lateral branch junctions of diameter not less than half the diameter of the branch to be removed. Reduce and shape as appropriate in similar method the lateral reach of the crown by approximately one metre.  This may be up to two metres where lateral growth is towards nos.24 and 25 Beacon Hill.  Crown lift to give clearance of three metres over road by shortening laterals and pendulous growth.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: All the tree work is to be carried out by a competent Tree Surgeon to the recommendation of BS3998: 1989 'Tree Work'. 

 REASON: To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
